alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 10:57AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jo Daviess and Stephenson Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1057 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lanark, or 7 miles east of Mount Carroll, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pearl City around 1105 AM CDT. Freeport, Cedarville and German Valley around 1115 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dakota, Ridott, Rock City and Davis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
